content.text:
# Presidents of the Hunterian Society

This is a list of presidents of the Hunterian Society, founded in London in 1819 in honour of the surgeon and anatomist John Hunter. Between 1940 and 1945 there was no president. Several were based at St Thomas' Hospital, Guy's Hospital, and the London Hospital. 36 of the society's first 48 presidents delivered the Hunterian Society Oration.
1819 - 1840
{| class="wikitable sortable sticky-header" style=text-align:center;
|-
! !!Portrait!! Name !! Term!!Oration/notes!!Base
|-
| 1 ||  ||Sir William Blizard  ||–|| Founding memberHaving been a pupil of Hunter, he suggested the title of the "Hunterian Society" rather than the initially proposed "London and Medical Physical"Elected president for three consecutive years||London Hospital
|-
| 2 || ||Benjamin Robinson
(d. 1828)
||– || During his presidency, the annual dinner was established, combined with the annual report and orationDied a fortnight after he delivered the Hunterian oration in 1828||London Hospital
|-
| 3|| ||William Babington ||–	 ||Founding member.Elected president for three consecutive years||Guy's Hospital
|-
| 4 || ||Sir Benjamin Travers || –|| Simultaneously served as president of the Royal Medical and Chirurgical Society of London.||St Thomas' Hospital
|-
| 5|| || Archibald Billing||– ||"An essay on auscultation of the heart" (1932)||London Hospital
|-
| 6||  ||Thomas Callaway ||– ||A former apprentice to Astley Cooper, Callaway delivered the society's oration to a large audience including Sir Robert Peel, nine days after Coopers death.||
|-
| 7|| || Charles Aston Key||– ||||Guy's Hospital
|-
| 8|| || Benjamin Guy Babington||– ||26 years before Manuel García, Babington described to the society a mirror to inspect the throat.||
|-
| 9|| ||Bransby Blake Cooper ||–||Nephew of Astley Cooper.||
|-
|10 || ||John Whiting||– ||||
|-
|11 || ||John Scott|| –||||
|-
